data.name: Connectd
data.description:
Connectd is a people-first platform connecting startups and scaleups with experienced fractional executives and strategic advisors. Using AI-powered insights and smart matching technology, we help ensure the right experts are placed with the right companies, so both sides can grow with confidence. In a world shaped by transformative technology, we provide a human-centred ecosystem where companies access the guidance they need to scale, and senior leaders find meaningful, flexible work that puts their experience to powerful use.

Since 2019, Connectd has facilitated over 10,000 connections across the UK and US, helping both sides of the ecosystem succeed: startups and scaleups gain trusted leadership at pivotal moments, and senior leaders and executives build dynamic, rewarding fractional careers.

Can0 water retails in some of the biggest stores in the UK including Tesco, Waitrose and many more. Co-founder Josh White discusses his journey, appetite for risk and ADHD. Topics discussed:

-Mental health
-The importance of physical health as a founder
-How CanO inspired CocaCola and Pepsi 
-Greenwashing

Full episode links in the comments:

In this truly open and inspirational conversation between Janos Barberis and Roei Samuel, both founders jump into the often unmentioned topic of founders' mental health.

This discussion aims to break down such barriers whilst providing 
practical advice to startup founders. 

Further topics centered around risk and covered the following:

-Financing his business by re-mortgaging his house
-Booking a one-way ticket to Hong Kong to build a company
-Not hiding in a corporate environment

More details in the comments.

From park ranger to working with Tyson Fury! UniTaskr founder and EY young entrepreneur of the year Joseph Black, sits down with Roei Samuel to touch upon his amazing journey of entrepreneurship to date. Topics covered:

-Big risk! Dropping out of uni and launching his business. 
-South Africa. How a trip here changed his perspective on life. 
-Hustle. Joseph discusses starting his first business at just 11.
-Changing lives. How UniTaskr is changing lives by tackling the student financial crisis. 

As always, the links to the full episode are in the comments.

Parallels between sports teams and startups?

CMO and growth expert Yoann Pavy discusses some of the experience learned from playing basketball and how this translates within a startup working environment, in this conversation with Roei Samuel.

At Connectd, we’re passionate about democratising the startup ecosystem and access to funding, supporting founders who may traditionally struggle to gain investment - gender equality is one of the core principles at the heart of this.

Join our expert panel to explore the need for organisations to accelerate efforts to achieve gender equality, especially in times of economic turbulence. Panel members include Google's Oksana Stowe & CMO at Pipe Yasmin Moaven as well as our host Connectd COO Claudia Stankler.

Tickets are limited, so secure yours now using the link in the comments.

Balancing being a founder and retaining a full-time job?

What inspired Millennial Money UK founder Niaz Azad to launch his venture, and how has he managed to continue to scale the business whilst maintaining a 9-5 position?

In this recent sitdown with Roei Samuel, the pair discuss:

-The role social media plays in money
-The freelancer & solopreneur jobs market 
-The challenge of balancing both hustles

Our latest funding round allows Connectd to innovate and expand the tools which allow startups to put data transparency at the heart of their business, enabling meaningful and frictionless performance monitoring and reporting.

The funds will also support further development of new features which will allow our rapidly growing community of investors and advisors to harness valuable connections.
 
Read the full press release and hear comments from the founder and CEO of Connectd Roei Samuel in the article below:

Head to our site today and kickstart your portfolio career.

To celebrate reaching this 10k milestone, we want to give back to our community with a free competition giveaway!  

We are granting one free place on our next helping hand programme in March, which includes:

-Full access to the investment network platform
-One guaranteed pro-bono advisor
-Portfolio reporting tools
-Investor ready-pitch day
-Three strategic consultations around your fundraise

Apply today through the two-minute survey link! Link in the comments and thanks again for following Connectd.

? Working within the F&B sector? This is a must-listen! 

Hear from serial founder Jamie Barber as he discusses why he left a successful and stable career to take a huge risk and join forces with Sir Roger Moore’s son, Jeffrey, to make an impact in London’s dining scene. 

Jamie's amazing portfolio includes an array of restaurants such as Hush Mayfair, Haché Burgers chain & Cabana Brasilian Barbecue group.

Topics discussed on the pod:

-Strategies employed as a restaurant owner
-Battling fears of failure and rejection
-Taking on food giants Ivy Cafe and THE MET BAR
-How to deal with industry food critics

Full episode links are available in the comments!

Last week we ran a female-led panel event in support of International Women's Day. Hear from Connectd COO Claudia Stankler who led this discussion with her thoughts:

"This year's theme for IWD 2023, #EmbraceEquity, really resonates with me, both as a female founder and as a member of the Connectd Team. As a company built on the aim of democratising the early-stage space and investment opportunities, gender equity is a cornerstone of our approach.

With that in mind, I wanted to say how honoured I was to be joined by Yasmin Moaven and Oksana Stowe at our breakfast event last week, where we explored the need to value difference, support inclusion and champion diversity for everyone in the early-stage space.
While equality is the goal, equity is how we will get there."

Our very own Claudia Stankler has been placed in the prestigious Forbes 30 under 30, 2023 awards this morning. 

This is a fantastic achievement and you can read more on all the nominees by accessing the link below. 

https://lnkd.in/evgj28aW

How do you develop a metaverse office for your agency?  

PinPointMedia founder Oliver Bruce discusses the rationale for this and his journey to proving doubters within the industry. 

-Developing a metaverse office
-The risks of raising investment
-NFT & Crypto 
-Impact of AI on the labour market

Access the full episode through the link in the comments.

“My goal as a leader is to make a safe space for everyone to have a work life, home life balance and that should happen as a man or a woman. This should be required, this dynamic should be built into organisations”

Yasmin Moaven, CMO & Investor Relations, Pipe.

#genderequality #connectd #startups
Join the conversation at our latest event by utilising the hashtag #connectd

“There are very few female GP’s, having fewer continues to perpetuate the problem” 

Oksana Stowe touches upon some of the challenges for female founding teams. 

#genderequality #diversityandinclusion #connectd

Cano Water® yesterday announced a-list, angel investment..... 

Sharing with the world that legendary comedian, actor, and screenwriter Ricky Gervais would be investing in the company, stating he was impressed by the company's commitment to sustainability and to being part of the solution to the earth's destruction. 

We take a look back at a recent conversation between Cano Water co-founder Josh White & Roei Samuel as they discuss risk appetite and Josh's journey in launching the company. 

Full episode link in the description.

?  Competition Winner Announcement ? 

Firstly thank you to all the applicants of our recent Helping Hand Programme competition. It was a pleasure for our startup team to have the chance to read over all of the submissions. The quality of the applicants really demonstrates the strength of the startup ecosystem. 

The competition winner selected is OLMA The Label; an amazing startup in the formative stages but aiming to inspire plus-sized women to be confident and express themselves freely. 

You can learn more about Olma's founder, Louise Asaye or pre-register your interest using a link in the comments.

Thanks again to everyone that engaged and we look forward to sharing our next competition in a few week's time  ?

Innovation is a staple hold of all successful entrepreneurs. Listen in to these fantastic insights from Pizza Pilgrims co-founder Thom Elliot as he discusses how the business pivoted in the face of Covid and created the "Pizza in the post" trend. 

Let us know your thoughts on the comments! 

#innovation #entrepreneurs #covid #business

One of the first questions many people ask when considering becoming a non-executive career is ‘What exactly is a non-executive director?'

Read up on our latest blog post as we dispel the role end to end and cover the following topics:

-Gaining experience
-Non-Executive Director pay
-Creating a stellar CV
-How Non-Executives are appointed 

Read up on the blog today {5 minute read - link in the comments}

#career  #nonexecutivedirector

? Investor & Founder Online Pitch Showcase Day - 17th April (12pm) ?

The session will be co-hosted by Michanne Steenbergen of True - a progressive consumer-focused VC firm dedicated to investing in innovators and those who are reimagining their industries.

Connect and invest with startups among the Connectd network through our online pitch showcase event which includes businesses across:

-Gaming
-SportTech
-Sustainability
-Consumer Goods
-Research
-Technology Solutions

Last chance to register for Monday's demo day (sign up for free - link in the comments)!

**Capital at risk.

Do you feel pressure as a founder? Do you lead in an emotionally sustainable manner?

Professional coach, vulnerability, mental health, and self-awareness expert Simon Cusden provides insights on the challenges today for business leaders in this recent conversation with Roei Samuel.

Link in the comments to the full episode ? 

#business #leaders #mentalhealth #founderstories

A huge thank you to all those who attended our investor only event last night at Soho House & Co White City - we can see the AI investment landscape is brimming with excitement and optimism! ?

Led by our panel Alexandra Mousavizadeh, Aaron Rosenberg, Professor Andy Pardoe, Oliver Yonchev and Sana Khareghani, they shared their expert knowledge on the landscape of AI and how they see this industry unfolding

If you’re keen to attend our events in future, hit the link to stay in the loop: https://lnkd.in/eHM7dXji

We hope to see you soon!

‘It was almost designed for us as much as it was for others’

A touching moment for Graham MacVoy and the Wake The Tiger team after receiving amazing feedback from only their second customer!

Formerly part of the creative team behind one of the largest immersive festivals in the world Boomtown Fair, Graham joins our founder Roei Samuel in the latest episode of #BigRiskEnergy to speak on his incredible journey so far 

Watch the full interview here: https://lnkd.in/eHaNju55

Or if you’d rather listen, click here: https://lnkd.in/eqZVnVqx

Less than 8 hours to go until our investor only event, featuring our expert panel who'll be discussing how to approach investment into the #AI space ? 

See you soon! #Connectd

Winner winner ? 

This month’s staff incentive winners take on Lord’s today!

Our data maestro Iz doesn’t look too happy to be here though….

?️? With Pride Month beginning today, we wanted to wish everyone celebrating a Happy Pride.

As we celebrate Pride, we recognise that there is still much progress to be made! We are dedicated to continuously improving, learning, and growing together, understanding that the journey toward complete inclusivity and diversity requires collective effort.

✍ New Speaker Announcement ✍ 

We’re delighted to announce that Sana Khareghani, former Head of UK Government Office for Artificial Intelligence is joining the panel for our upcoming event at Soho House & Co, White City.

Jealousy within the founder community is a real thing, but I do understand.

You may be going through the lowest of lows whilst a fellow founder has just successfully raised for Series A. It sucks, I’ve been there.

But remember, not everyone shows their dark moments. Social media is full of people only showing the good times.

Rather than harbour this negative energy, ask for advice. As humans, we’re a community based species and we didn’t get to where we are today alone.

Founders remember, working with each other is the only way we’ll grow.

Would you agree?

Becoming a #NonExecutiveDirector can seem daunting, but we're here to guide you along the way, just like we did for Jon Watts ?

What happens when you ask 850 people to pitch their dream with zero prep?

In under 60 seconds, 
the whole room shifted.

Cordell Jeffers reminded us that your starting point isn’t your final one.

Amelia Sordell ? said what most won’t build your brand, stop waiting for permission.

Simon Squibb gave away £10K to help Daisy get to the next level in her shoe business.

Hajar J. Woodland closed with a stand-up that had me missing my own days on stage.

And the HelpBnk team?They’ve helped 240,000 people and counting — and now they’re partnering with Richard Branson and Virgin.

That’s what happens when you build with heart, focusing on giving without receiving.

When it was my turn on stage, 
I dropped the script and asked:
“Who here has a dream they want to pitch?”

Hands went up and the room got loud. 

Kate Whitley stood up. 

She shared how her pain led her to build something powerful for the neurodiverse community.

Raw. Brave. Real.

Here’s what I told the founders in the room:

– You don’t need to go full-time to make full-time impact.
– You don’t need to build alone to prove you’re capable.
– You don’t need it all figured out to start.We need more rooms like that.

More hands in the air.
More people starting messy.

If you were there, what moment stuck with you? 

If you weren’t, what dream would you pitch if you had 60 seconds and no slides?

Drop it in the comments. 
Let’s keep this energy moving.

P.s thank you Zain Noor Claudia Stankler Harriet Oliver Emily Brooke @Ally hutson Presence P. Jim Dixon Tom Bromley-Davenport, @Elliot Alexander Rose for coming along,

and the HelpBnk team Adrien Hastert Kim Richardson, Simon Howard  Adam Smith for the event.

Finding the right opportunity shouldn’t feel like searching for a needle in a haystack ?

Our CEO, Roei Samuel, recently shared his views with Fast Company on how professionals can stand out on LinkedIn in today’s AI-driven world.

He highlighted that only about 1% of LinkedIn’s 260M users actively post, yet those who showcase their work and expertise are the ones who truly stand out.

At Connectd, we see this every day. Professionals in our network aren’t just building visibility online but they’re demonstrating their expertise by helping startups scale, mentoring founders and taking on impactful fractional roles.
